intro: Hibbertia hamulosa, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Hibbertia hamulosa is known for its ability to attract native pollinators such as bees and birds. Its ecological importance lies in its role as a food source and habitat for various wildlife species.
